name: Chitubox Project
summary: Learn about .CHITUBOX files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: Using Chitubox, 3D printer users can import, arrange, edit, and slice 3D models for printing. While preparing one or more 3D models, users can save their current Chitubox project as a CHITUBOX file. This allows the user to continue editing the project (and the models it contains) in the future.
To slice the models a CHITUBOX file contains, open the file in Chitubox and then click the Slice button. This allows you to:
Save your CHITUBOX file in one of several sliced formats (including Chitubox's .CBDDLP and .CTB formats)
Directly transfer a sliced version of your CHITUBOX file to a connected 3D printer
NOTE: Chitubox is available in Basic and Pro versions. Both versions create and can open CHITUBOX files.

description: A CHITUBOX file is a project file created by Chitubox, a program used to prepare 3D models for 3D printing. It typically contains one or more 3D models, which have been arranged and edited for use with a 3D printer.

instructions: You can open a CHITUBOX file with Chitubox. To do so:
Select the program's sandwich menu (in the upper-left corner).
Navigate to and open your CHITUBOX file.
You can use Chitubox to convert the 3D models a CHITUBOX file contains to the following formats:
Open your CHITUBOX file in Chitubox.
Choose All Models or Selected Model.

images.caption: CHITUBOX file open in Chitubox
